edu.up.cs301.tictactoe
Class TTTHumanPlayer1

java.lang.Object
  edu.up.cs301.game.GameHumanPlayer
      edu.up.cs301.tictactoe.TTTHumanPlayer
          edu.up.cs301.tictactoe.TTTHumanPlayer1
All Implemented Interfaces:
Animator, GamePlayer, Tickable, TTTPlayer
Direct Known Subclasses:
TTTHumanPlayer2
public class TTTHumanPlayer1
extends TTTHumanPlayer
implements Animator

A GUI that allows a human to play tic-tac-toe. Moves are made by clicking regions on a canvas

Version:
July 2013
Author:
Steven R. Vegdahl

interval

public int interval()
Description copied from interface: Animator
The time interval (in milliseconds) between animation frames. Thus, for example, to draw a frame 20 times per second, you would return 50. This method is called once at the beginning of the animation, so changing the value during the animation will have no effect.

Specified by:
interval in interface Animator
Returns:
the time interval for the animation

backgroundColor

public int backgroundColor()
Description copied from interface: Animator
The background color with which to paint the canvas before the animation frame is drawn. This method is called at each tick, so the background color can change dynamically by having this method return different values.

Specified by:
backgroundColor in interface Animator
Returns:
the animation's background color

onTouch

public void onTouch(MotionEvent event)
callback method when the screen it touched. We're looking for a screen touch (which we'll detect on the "up" movement" onto a tic-tac-tie square

Specified by:
onTouch in interface Animator
Parameters:
event - the motion event that was detected

drawSymbol

protected void drawSymbol(Canvas g,
                          char sym,
                          int col,
                          int row)
Draw a symbol (X or O) on the canvas in a particular location

Parameters:
g - the graphics object on which to draw
sym - the symbol to draw (X or O)
col - the column number of the square on which to draw (0, 1 or 2)
col - the row number of the square on which to draw (0, 1 or 2)

mapPixelToSquare

public Point mapPixelToSquare(int x,
                              int y)
maps a point from the canvas' pixel coordinates to "square" coordinates

Parameters:
x - the x pixel-coordinate
y - the y pixel-coordinate
Returns:
a Point whose components are in the range 0-2, indicating the column and row of the corresponding square on the tic-tac-toe board, or null if the point does not correspond to a square
